results.title: Verdict at 1.32
results.creator_credit: International Temperance Society, Burt Martin and Charles Davis
results.brief_description: Dramatically depicts the effects of alcohol, stressing that consuming even the smallest quantities of alcohol can be dangerous. Tells the story of a young secretary who has two cocktails while out to lunch with her fiance. Her reaction dulled when driving back to work, she cannot brake in time and is killed, killing another person, also an alcoholic. Subsequently both their brains are examined by a neurologist; and the effects of alcohol on reaction times and normal co-ordination, convincingly demonstrated at a physiology lecture and a sports car gymkhana.

results.title: Verdi Requiem
results.brief_description: Verdi, himself an honoured patriotic figure, held the poet Alessandro Manzoni in the highest esteem. The great Requiem Mass, as superb and typical as any of his operas, was composed by Verdi in memory of Il Santo Don Alessandro. A rare gathering of four of the world’s most distinguished soloists - Jessye Norman, Margaret Price, Jose Carreras, and Ruggero Raimondi - sets the scene for an unforgettable performance of one of the finest of all Requiem Masses. From the Edinburgh International Festival the London Symphony Orchestra is conducted by Claudio Abbado.

results.title: Verbal communication: the power of words
results.creator_credit: CRM Productions, Stephen Judson and Peter Jordan
results.brief_description: Uses animation, humorous vignettes, and dramatized slices of organizational life to illustrate the four critical parts of every verbal exchange: the speaker, the language used, the atmosphere, and the listener. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Venus beauty = Venus beaute (institut)
results.creator_credit: Agat Films, Cie, Arte France, Tabo Tabo Films, Gilles Sandoz, Isabelle Pailley, Emanuelle Pinet and Tonie Marshall
results.brief_description: Forty-something Angele works in a French beauty parlour named Venus Beauty, attending to the vanities and vulnerabilities of a parade of eccentric regulars. Despite her reassuring manner when dealing with her clients, Angele’s personal life is a secret mess which no amount of cosmetic pampering can set straight. Having long decided that ‘mutual love doesn’t exist’ she picks up strangers in cafes and bars for non-committal one night stands. One day she meets Antoine who confesses that he has been harbouring a secret love for her in spite of the fact that he already has a twenty year-old girlfriend who is one of Angele’s clients. Despite her initial reluctance Angele gradually becomes drawn into a relationship with Antoine discovering for the first time the elations, fixations and pitfalls of ‘amour fou’. The film shifts from farce to tragedy and back with sensitivity. Warm, wry and bitter-sweet, it never resorts to sentimentality in its portrayal of late-blooming love. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Nathalie Baye, Bulle Ogier and Samuel Le Bihan.

results.title: Venus and Mars
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Venus and Earth appear to be sister planets, similar in size. Earth, with its oxygen based atmosphere, and water mass, supports life. The atmosphere of Venus is a deadly cocktail of “Greenhouse” gases, and the planet’s surface is heavily shrouded in clouds, which modern satellies have only just penetrated. Mars, on the other hand, seemed the most likely planet to support life. On the surface, polar caps could be identified, and features that resembling water-bearing canals were also evident. Unfortunately, this was not the case and so the search for life elsewhere in the universe continues.

results.title: Venice: queen of the Adriatic
results.brief_description: Narrated by Grace Jackman, with poetry and readings inspired by Venice, read by Richard Levine, viewers are taken on a journey through Venice - a city of breathtaking beauty and a thousand years of colourful history. A conglomeration of landmarks ranging fron the Byzantine San Marco to the pink marbled Palazzo Ducale, the famous Campanele in Piazza San Marco to the canals and bridges, Venice has inspired great artists and writers throughout the ages. Despite the state of “gorgeous decay”, Venice remains a jewel to be treasured - a perpetual source of wonder and mystery.

results.title: Venice: queen city of the Adriatic
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Clifford J. Kamen Productions
results.brief_description: Animated drawings and maps explain why and how Venice was founded, and how the city grew into the commercial centre of the Eastern Mediterranean and then declined with the discovery of new western trade routes. St Mark’s Cathedral, the Doge’s Palace and the Casa d’Oro exemplify the wealth and individuality in art and architecture of Venice during her zenith, Venetian life and industries are described in their present conditions.

results.title: Venice the magnificent
results.brief_description: A day in the life of Venice. Features the goldolas, canals, palaces and churches of Venice; art and architecture; history; daily life of the Venetians; Rialto Bridge on the Grand Canal; St Mark’s Piazza; the Grand Carnival.

results.title: Venice in peril
results.brief_description: Briefly surveys the history of Venice and explains the cultural value of the city. Shows the subsidence, floods and pollution, and of social and industrial changes which together endanger it’s welfare. The Italian Government, in co-operation with Unesco is working out measures in an attempt to save the city.

results.title: Vengo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Princes Films, Arte France and Tony Gatlif
results.brief_description: Tony Gatlif revisits gypsy life in “Vengo” and once again reveals its passion, splendour, and poetry. Set in the plains of Andalucia, “Vengo” centres on Caco (Antonio Canales), a charismatic, important figure in the local community, who mourns the recent death of his daughter, Pepa. Caco transfers his protective love onto his nephew, Diego (Orestes Villasan Rodriguez), whose life is under threat because his father has murdered a member of the Caravacas, a neighbouring gypsy family. “Vengo” retells the age-old tale of vengeance and rivalry in the local village, infusing it with immense poetry and life. Like “Latcho drom” and “The Crazy stranger”, “Vengo” shows that music is a defining aspect of gypsy life. It is an expression of their passion and connection to all things sensual, emotional, rhythmic and physical. What Gatlif achieves with “Vengo” is an operatic portrait of local gypsy culture that is at once uplifting and liberating for its musical qualities and insightful and rewarding for its observation of cultural traditions. In Spanish with English subtitles.
